For Cage-2 and Cage-3, the solvent systems of acetonitrile/CH 2Cl2 and 2-cyanopyridine are adopted. For Cage-3, diffusion of acetonitrile to the pyridine solution also can obtain crystals. In addition, the crystal of reference compound 5 (triphenylbenzene) is gained by recrystallization in 1,4-dioxane. The crystal structures are performed in an X-ray diffractometer (XRD, X-Pert, PANalytic, Netherlands) with Cu K¦Á radiation (40 kV, 30 mA). CCDC 2107131-2107135 contain the supplementary crystallographic data for this paper. The crystal structures were analyzed and refined by SHELX-program suite and OLEX2.S61.5 The single-crystal data of compound 5 and Cage-1, 2, 3Table S2. Crystal data and structure refinement.

¡öEXPERIMENTAL SECTIONGeneral Information. 1,3,5-Benzenetricarboxaldehyde (C9H6O3,97%), 4,4,4-nitrilotribenzaldehyde (C21H15NO3, 98%), 1,3,5-tris( p-formylphenyl)benzene (C 27H18O3, 98%), 1,4-dioxane (C 4H8O2,99.5%), acetic acid glacial (C2H4O2, 99.5%), acetonitrile (C2H3N,99.9%), n-hexane (C6H14, 97%), tetrahydrofuran (THF, C4H8O,98%), and dichloromethane (DCM, CH 2Cl2, 99.9%) were allpurchased from Energy Chemica l and used as received. 1,8-Anthracenediamine was synthesized according to previously reportedprocedures.51Synthesis of the Organic Molecular Cage Series. Asuspension of 1,3,5-tris( p-formylphenyl)benzene (156 mg, 0.4mmol), 1,8-anthracenediamine (125 mg, 0.6 mmol), and acetic acid(3 mL, 52 mmol) in 1,4-dioxane (30 mL) was stirred for 0.5 h atroom temperature. Then the mixture was heated to 120 ¡ãCi na no i lbath. After 3 days, the reaction mixture was concentrated. The solidwas suspended in a large batch of DCM, and the mixture was ?ltered.

40?43,52It normallytakes a long reaction time for the conversion with a moderateconversion ratio. Therefore, the development of a rapid andclean interconversion between monomeric and interlockedcages is highly desirable. Here, a purely covalent organicinterlocked cage was successfully synthesized by [2 + 3] Schi ?base condensation reaction. Notably, only a few monomericReceived: November 2, 2021Published: January 24, 2022Article pubs.acs.org/joc? 2022 American Chemical Society2767https://doi.org/10.1021/acs.joc.1c02688J. Org. ¡öRESULTS AND DISCUSSION1,8-Anthracenediamine ( 4) containing two amine groups waschosen as one of the reactants. 1,3,5-Tris( p-formylphenyl)-benzene ( 1) containing three aldehyde groups was ?rst chosenas the other precursor. The Schi ?base condensation has beenwidely used for the construction of MIMs due to its reversiblebond formation and self-healing behavior.28In this work, the[2 + 3] Schi ?base condensation is supposed to lead to theformation of a cage structure. To our surprise, the matrix-assisted laser desorption ionization-time-of- ?ight mass spec-trometry (MALDI-TOF MS) revealed that the molecularweight of the obtained compound ( Cage-1 ) was 2596, which istwice the molecular weight of a monomeric molecular cage(1298). This observation suggested the formation of dualinterlocked cages. Subsequently, two control experiments weredone ( Figure 1 ). The central building units changed fromtriphenylbenzene ( 1) to benzene ( 2) and triphenylamine ( 3).
